meanings.definition: A lack of compatibility or similarity between two or more facts or pieces of information.
meanings.sent1: The teacher noticed discrepancies in the students' test scores.
meanings.sent2: The accountant found discrepancies in the financial records.
meanings.sent3: The detective chuckled at the discrepancies in the suspect's alibi.
meanings.sent4: The map showed discrepancies between the actual location and the marked spot.
meanings.sent5: The scientist highlighted the discrepancies in the research findings.

meanings.definition: Differences or inconsistencies between two or more things.
meanings.sent1: There were discrepancies in the sizes of the shoes she tried on.
meanings.sent2: The team discovered discrepancies in the witness statements.
meanings.sent3: The chef playfully pointed out the discrepancies in the identical-looking dishes.
meanings.sent4: The artist's painting revealed discrepancies between the colors he intended to use.
meanings.sent5: The siblings argued over the discrepancies in their memories of the family vacation.
